titleStmt.title: Letter from John Myers O'Hara to John G. Neihardt, December 31, 1900
titleStmt.author: O'Hara, John Myers, 1870-1944

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Neihardt, John Gneisenau, 1881-1973
bibl.title: Letter from John Myers O'Hara to John G. Neihardt

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. Review, Additional Encoding

div1.p: I have received your fine letter, and I thank you from my heart for the splendid words of praise which you have given "Pagan Sonnets" and "The Trophies." I was delighted to know that for many years you have liked my work — it is deeply appreciated, coming from you, one of the greatest poets that America has produced. Every line of yours that I have read has the distinctive seal of genius. Many of your lyrics have never been surpassed. I remember talking about you with George Sterling — poor George — many years ago, and how enthusiastic we both were about your poetry. And it's a great regret with me that we should not have known each other before. I should be more than grateful if you could send me your notice of "The Trophies." I have only seen the short excerpt from it in the John Day catalogue, and I feel it will be a real calamity to miss it. I am sending you a copy of the limited edition of "The Trophies" as a small token of my appreciation. With all good wishes, believe me.
